# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

You can use the built-in `lowercase` function in Julia to lower case a string. To replace all spaces and hyphens with underscores you can use the `replace` method with a regular expression, replacing " -" or " "(whitespace) with "_". Here is an example of how you could write this function:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(col), r"[ _-]+" => "_")
end
``` 
This function takes a string as input and returns the same string, but with leading, trailing, and any interior spaces or hyphens replaced by underscores. The `r"[ _-]+"` regular expression matches one or more consecutive spaces or hyphens.
